# GistPreview

> Transform GitHub Gists into beautifully rendered web pages

## What is GistPreview?

GistPreview is a modern web application that renders GitHub Gists as beautifully formatted web pages. Built with React 19 and TypeScript, it supports intelligent content-type detection for HTML, Markdown, React/JSX, JSON, CSS, and JavaScript.

## Key Features

- **Smart Content Detection**: Automatically detects content type from file content, not just extensions
- **Live React Rendering**: JSX files are automatically transpiled and executed in real-time
- **Responsive Preview**: Toggle between desktop, tablet, and mobile viewports
- **Shareable Links**: Generate permanent URLs for your gist previews
- **Screenshot Capture**: Capture and copy screenshots with one click
- **Fullscreen Mode**: Immersive preview with locked mode for shared links

## Supported Content Types

- HTML (full webpage rendering with CSS/JS injection)
- Markdown (GitHub-flavored with dark theme styling)
- React/JSX (live React apps with automatic Babel transpilation)
- JSON (syntax-highlighted with color-coded keys and values)
- CSS (line numbers with language badge)
- JavaScript (code view with syntax highlighting)

## Tech Stack

- React 19
- TypeScript
- Vite 7
- Tailwind CSS 4.1
- shadcn/ui
- Framer Motion

## Getting Started

1. Visit https://animeshkundu.github.io/gist-preview/
2. Paste any GitHub Gist URL or gist ID
3. Click Preview
4. Share the generated link
